TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

> Vsync is disabled because the compositor handles that, and I have anti-aliasing off because it doesn't seem to do anything on Linux.  Instead, I'm forcing 4xMS+4xCS with an application profile.
> 

Alright, thanks!

Hi [@blackrack](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/104258-blackrack/), the new update seems to be great!

![4aTplx1.png](http://i.imgur.com/4aTplx1.png)

Thanks in advance!

hey [@blackrack](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/104258-blackrack/) just an update of my shadow issue, tried to change many parameters as shadows cascades, AA, anisotropic like [@Vegemeister](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/135079-vegemeister/) but nothing worked.

it look to work nice with DX11 forced, sadly it give me bad performance. Also i have an exception in the debug, i can provide a log if you want to take a look.

despite this issue, the game look really nice, thanks for your time!

In my experience it still happpens in dx11, also depends on the terrain slope and the time of day, obviously. If it's the one exception/nullref after OnDestroy() is called you can ignore it, it's not a big deal.

I was unable to find any posts about this. Do you know what happened to my ocean? It appears perfectly fine in game, but it is gone in all my screenshots. I was ~20 meters from the ocean surface. What other information do you need?

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/Fheaz/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

> 
> 
> Just now, Galahir950 said:
> 
> 
> I was unable to find any posts about this. Do you know what happened to my ocean? It appears perfectly fine in game, but it is gone in all my screenshots. I was ~20 meters from the ocean surface. What other information do you need?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> <iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/Fheaz/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>
> 

Log?  Is it possible that it's the system that KSP uses to render the water?  It may not be rendering that camera when in the screenshot.  Just a thought.

> 
> 
> 9 minutes ago, Galahir950 said:
> 
> 
> I was unable to find any posts about this. Do you know what happened to my ocean? It appears perfectly fine in game, but it is gone in all my screenshots. I was ~20 meters from the ocean surface. What other information do you need?
> 

Do you maybe have supersampling enabled for screenshots? I noticed that flares disappeared for me when I enabled supersampling, but otherwise they would appear. Perhaps it's a similar issue?  

Edit: I'm willing to bet that's it, I just checked some screenshots I made yesterday that I hadn't looked at that included the ocean in them and they appear the same way.

So I'm having some issues related to what I think is landscape shadows since I don't see as much problem with them turned off.

See imgur album below:

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/53z4b/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

The patterns move as time goes on, I turned post processing off in one of them to show how the shadows appear to be rendering. I looked through at least 10 pages of the thread and did a search and couldn't turn up anything similar. Is there any familiarity with how to resolve this?

Thanks!
